intro: Cordia tobagensis, commonly known as the Togabensis glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruits are fleshy, berry-like structures that turn red when mature. Cordia tobagensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
